articles.title: Floral Baskets Sent to DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Sent to DPRK Embassies 
    Pyongyang, August 24 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were sent to the DPRK embassies in Conakry, Jakarta and Kuala Lumpur by the Party for Unity and Progress of Guinea, the chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, the chairman of the Vanguard Party of Indonesia, the managers of the Yangji Travel Agency, the T. T. Latex Company and the M. K. P. Company of Malaysia on Aug. 15 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
 They were laid before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and full-length portraits of the President and the leader in the DPRK embassies there.

articles.title: Day of Korea's Liberation Marked in Peru
articles.content:
Day of Korea's Liberation Marked in Peru 
    Pyongyang, August 24 (KCNA) -- The Peru Group for the Study of Kimilsungism issued a bulletin titled "President Kim Il Sung Is National Liberator" on August 13 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
 The Korean people greeted the liberation of the country on August 15, 1945, thanks to the outstanding military idea and stratagem and unremitting brilliant struggle of Kim Il Sung who embarked upon the road of revolution in his teens, the bulletin said, stressing: The feats performed by him who set a good example of the national liberation struggle in colonial countries will shine long in the modern history of Korea as well as in the world's history of national liberation struggles.    
 On the same day the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship issued a commemorative bulletin titled "History of Korean People's Struggle to Defend Sovereignty."

Cooperation for Peace against War Called for
articles.content:
Cooperation for Peace against War Called for 
    Pyongyang, August 24 (KCNA) -- It is the common cause of the nation to protect peace and security on the Korean Peninsula. All Koreans in the north, the south and overseas should fully realize cooperation for peace against war to deal telling blows at the U.S. imperialists keen to start a new war through their concerted efforts and fulfill their responsibility and role as masters in hewing out the destiny of the nation and achieving national reunification.
 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a signed article. It goes on:
 The "Ulji Focus Lens-05" joint military exercises launched by the U.S. imperialist warmongers again in south Korea are a blatant challenge to the Koreans desirous of reunification and a serious threat to the peace and security on the peninsula. To achieve the above-said cooperation represents a struggle to frustrate the moves of the foreign forces for a war of aggression and preserve the peace and security of the country by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.
 It is an urgent and essential requirement for hewing out the destiny of the Korean nation to realize the above-said form of cooperation.
 In the 50s of the last century the United States provoked a war of aggression against the DPRK in order to dominate the whole of Korea, inflicting war disasters upon the Koreans. It has watched for a chance to invade the DPRK for scores of years. It has steadily modified and supplemented its operation plans to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK and staged such joint military war drills as RSOI, "Foal Eagle" and "Ulji Focus Lens" in an effort to grasp and round off them.    
 Cooperation for peace against war that calls on the Koreans to pool their efforts in the struggle against war indicates a right way of providing a peaceful precondition for national reunification and prosperity. 
 The above-said form of cooperation is urgently required by the era and the nation.    
 The fellow countrymen living in the June 15 era of reunification wish to achieve the reunification and prosperity of the nation in the spirit of "By our nation itself." War and division are quite contrary to the will of the Korean nation.    
 The above-said form of cooperation means the response of the fellow countrymen to the call of the era and nation and a basic way of frustrating the U.S. moves for a war of aggression against the DPRK. 
 The struggle for peace against war is one sure to triumph, the article concludes.

articles.title: S. Korean Singer Performs in Pyongyang
articles.content:
S. Korean Singer Performs in Pyongyang 
    Pyongyang, August 24 (KCNA) -- Jo Yong Phil, south Korean singer who is on a visit to Pyongyang at the invitation of the National Reconciliation Council, gave his performance at the Ryugyong Jong Ju Yong Gymnasium Tuesday.
 It was appreciated by Chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the council, An Kyong Ho, chairman of the north side's preparatory committee for joint functions of Koreans in the north and the south and overseas to implement the June 15 joint declaration, Ri Jong Hyok, vice-chairman of the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, officials concerned and artistes and working people in the city.
 Also present there were Yun Se Yong, president of south Korean SBS, and members of the south Korean visiting group including national assemblymen.
 The performance began with solo "The Eye of the Sun." He put on the stage solos including "Oh, My Friend," "Life" and "Arirang in Dream."
 He also successfully presented such songs of the north as "We've Met again after Undergoing Bitter Hardship" and "Lullaby" and songs dating back to the period of enlightenment including "Touch-me-not" and "The Ruined Castle" to the acclaim of the audience.    
 The performers were presented with bouquets at the end of the performance.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises under Fire
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises under Fire 
    Pyongyang, August 24 (KCNA) -- The United States and south Korea began Ulji Focus Lens-05 joint military exercises in south Korea on Aug. 22 which will last till Sept. 2.
 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a signed commentary:
 The U.S. is getting itself fully ready for another Korean war while pushing forward the reorganization and relocation of its forces according to the operation plan for the invasion of the DPRK and staging joint military exercises with south Korea and Japan one after another. The on-going saber-rattling is, therefore, a preliminary operation to provoke the Korean war of aggression.
 It goes on:    
 The exercises are aimed to round off the preparations for a preemptive attack on the DPRK, ratchet up the situation on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme pitch of tension, hamstring the favorable process of reconciliation and cooperation between the north and the south and pressurize the DPRK by force of arms to meet the unreasonable demands it raised at the six-party talks.
 Should the U.S. persistently escalate its military provocations and war moves against the DPRK, showing no change in its policy of stifling it as now, the prospect of confidence building between Pyongyang and Washington will be remote and the situation will turn more complicated.    
 The reality compels the army and people of the DPRK to heighten vigilance against the U.S. sophism that it would "neither attack nor invade the DPRK" and reinforce its determination to bolster its military deterrence in every way.
 The U.S. bellicose forces should ponder over the serious consequences to be entailed by their madcap military exercises against the DPRK and immediately stop the Ulji Focus Lens-05 joint military exercises that go against peace and dialogue.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, August 24 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the General Union of Syrian Peasants.
 It was conveyed to an official concerned by its executive member who is heading its delegation on a visit to the DPRK.

Greetings to Ukrainian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Ukrainian President
    Pyongyang, August 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Victor Yusenko, president of Ukraine, on August 24 on the occasion of the 14th national day.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Ukraine would develop on good terms, the message wished him greater success in his responsible work for stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Credentials Presented to Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Credentials Presented to Kim Yong Nam
    Pyongyang, August 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, was presented with credentials by Leandro Arellano, Mexican ambassador e. p. to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday. 
 On hand were Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.    
 The president conversed with the ambassador after receiving his credentials.

Kim Yong Nam Meets S. Korean Singer and Members of Visiting Group
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets S. Korean Singer and Members of Visiting Group
    Pyongyang, August 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Jo Yong Phil, south Korean singer, and Yun Se Yong, president of the SBS, and other leading members of the visiting group of south Korea in a compatriotic atmosphere at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand were Ri Jong Hyok, vice-chairman of the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, and Pak Kyong Chol, vice-chairman of the National Reconciliation Council.
